title: Variable seaIce.mon.sisnmass_tavg-u-hm-u (SImon.sisnmasss)
Comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.
Long name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice South

title: Variable seaIce.mon.sisnmass_tavg-u-hm-u (SImon.sisnmassn)
Comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.
Long name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice North

title: Variable seaIce.mon.simpeffconc_tavg-u-hxy-si (SImon.simpeffconc)
Comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by open melt ponds, that is melt ponds that are not covered by snow or ice lids. This represents the effective (i.e. radiatively-active) melt pond area fraction.
Long name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Effective Melt Pond

title: Variable seaIce.mon.siflsaltbot_tavg-u-hxy-si (SImon.siflsaltbot)
Comment: Total flux of salt from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This flux is upward (negative) during ice growth when salt is embedded into the ice and downward (positive) during melt when salt from sea ice is again released to the ocean.
Long name: Salt Flux from Sea Ice
Processing notes: Identical to the now-deprecated CMIP6 variable SImon.sfdsi; Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.
Expression UKESM1: ((meltt + meltb + meltl - congel - frazil) * ICE_DENSITY + melts * SNOW_DENSITY) / (100. * SECONDS_IN_DAY * aice) * REF_SALINITY / 1000.

title: Variable seaIce.day.sivol_tavg-u-hm-u (SIday.sivols)
Comment: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.
Long name: Sea-Ice Volume South

title: Variable seaIce.day.sivol_tavg-u-hm-u (SIday.sivoln)
Comment: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.
Long name: Sea-Ice Volume North

title: Variable seaIce.day.tssi_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.sitempsnic)
Comment: Mean temperature at the snow-ice interface. This is the surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero.
Long name: Temperature at Snow-Ice Interface
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.sitempbot_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.sitempbot)
Comment: Mean temperature at the base of the sea ice, NOT the temperature within lowermost sea-ice model layer.
Long name: Temperature at Ice-Ocean Interface
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.sisnmass_tavg-u-hm-u (SIday.sisnmasss)
Comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.
Long name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice South

title: Variable seaIce.day.sisnmass_tavg-u-hm-u (SIday.sisnmassn)
Comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.
Long name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice North

title: Variable seaIce.day.sisnhc_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.sisnhc)
Comment: Heat content of all snow in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Snow-water equivalent at 0 C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include the heat content of sea ice.
Long name: Snow Heat Content

title: Variable seaIce.day.sisaltmass_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.sisaltmass)
Comment: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the total mass of all salt in sea ice should be calculated from the salinity value used in the calculation of the salt budget.
Long name: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice
Processing notes: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area

title: Variable seaIce.day.sisali_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.sisali)
Comment: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the mean salinity used in the calculation of the salt budget should be reported.
Long name: Sea-Ice Salinity
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.sithickrdg_tavg-u-hxy-sir (SIday.sirdgthick)
Comment: Total volume of ridged sea ice divided by area of ridges, i.e. mean thickness of ridged sea ice.
Long name: Ridged Ice Thickness
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.sirdgconc_tavg-u-hxy-u (SIday.sirdgconc)
Comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is ridged sea ice.
Long name: Fraction of Ridged Sea Ice
Processing notes: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice.

title: Variable seaIce.day.simpthick_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.simpthick)
Comment: Average depth of melt ponds on sea ice, that is melt pond volume divided by melt pond area.
Long name: Melt Pond Depth
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.simprefrozen_tavg-u-hxy-simp (SIday.simprefrozen)
Comment: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by melt pond covered area.
Long name: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.simpeffconc_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.simpeffconc)
Comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by open melt ponds, that is melt ponds that are not covered by snow or ice lids. This represents the effective (i.e. radiatively-active) melt pond area fraction.
Long name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Effective Melt Pond

title: Variable seaIce.day.simpconc_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.simpconc)
Comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by melt ponds.
Long name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Melt Pond

title: Variable seaIce.day.sithickitd_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siitdthick)
Comment: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each ice thickness category, NOT volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis).
Long name: Sea-Ice Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.snditd_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siitdsnthick)
Comment: Actual thickness of snow in each ice thickness category, NOT snow volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis). It can also be derived by dividing the volume of snow by the area of snow in each thickness category.
Long name: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.sncitd_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siitdsnconc)
Comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by snow in each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).
Long name: Snow Area Fractions in Ice Thickness Categories

title: Variable seaIce.day.siconcitd_tavg-u-hxy-sea (SIday.siitdconc)
Comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).
Long name: Sea-Ice Area Fractions in Ice Thickness Categories

title: Variable seaIce.day.sihc_tavg-u-hxy-sea (SIday.sihc)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Water at 0C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. This variable does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water. Note that the CF standard name is incorrect since heat content is not only function of temperature but also of salinity, plus the link with temperature is not linear. A new CF standard name is currently being proposed to address this issue (https://github.com/cf-convention/vocabularies/issues/253).
Long name: Sea-Ice Heat Content

title: Variable seaIce.day.rsus_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siflswutop)
Comment: Upward shortwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
Long name: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.rsds_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siflswdtop)
Comment: Downwelling shortwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
Long name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.siflswdbot_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siflswdbot)
Comment: Downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice, i.e. the amount of shortwave radiation that penetrates the sea ice and reaches the sea ice-ocean interface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
Long name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux under Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.hfss_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siflsenstop)
Comment: Net sensible heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
Long name: Net Downward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.siflsensbot_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siflsensbot)
Comment: Net sensible heat flux under sea ice from or to the ocean (energy flow per sea ice area). Per sign convention, heat from the ocean is counted as negative since it describes an upward heat flux.
Long name: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux under Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.rlus_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.sifllwutop)
Comment: Upward longwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
Long name: Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.rlds_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.sifllwdtop)
Comment: Downwelling longwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
Long name: Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.hfls_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.sifllattop)
Comment: Net latent heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
Long name: Net Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.siflcondtop_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siflcondtop)
Comment: Net heat conduction flux at the ice surface, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the uppermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the surface of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
Long name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Surface
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.siflcondbot_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siflcondbot)
Comment: Net heat conduction flux at the ice base, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the lowermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the base of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
Long name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Base
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.sifb_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.sifb)
Comment: Mean height of sea-ice surface (i.e. snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level. This follows the classical definition of freeboard for in situ observations. In the satellite community, sometimes the total height of sea ice and snow above sea level is referred to as freeboard. This can easily be calculated by adding sisnthick to sifb.
Long name: Sea-Ice Freeboard
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.day.siextent_tavg-u-hm-u (SIday.siextents)
Comment: Total integrated area of all Southern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 0.15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.
Long name: Sea-Ice Extent South

title: Variable seaIce.day.siextent_tavg-u-hm-u (SIday.siextentn)
Comment: Total integrated area of all Northern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 0.15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.
Long name: Sea-Ice Extent North

title: Variable seaIce.day.siarea_tavg-u-hm-u (SIday.siareas)
Comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.
Long name: Sea-Ice Area South

title: Variable seaIce.day.siarea_tavg-u-hm-u (SIday.siarean)
Comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.
Long name: Sea-Ice Area North

title: Variable seaIce.day.siage_tavg-u-hxy-si (SIday.siage)
Comment: Age of sea ice since its formation in open water.
Long name: Age of Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.
